ah good point yes so in in my ground truth slide there was a feature called
active learning well I didn't get into the details of ground truth because that's again a separate talk that we
offer now active learning in ground truth is a feature where machine learns
alongside humans and do the leveling so let's say you have 1,000 cats and dogs
images that you create a job and send to human workers so if you turn the active
leveling feature on what sage maker will do is it will probably let's say send
first 50 or hundred images to the human workers and it will see the confidence score that is getting from the human
worker and you will without any of your input if you automatically train a model inside sage maker itself and this is not
a model that you are specifically training sage maker sets it off internally for you and tries to see
whether there's a strong correlation between the input and output in certain cases and then for rest of the input
data if it says they're worthless it can have a very high confidence factor then it will do the leveling
itself and not send those to the human workers so if you do that then you are
basically saving on cost as well so now with this feature on instead of thousand images being leveled by human workers
maybe only 500 or 600 will be leveled by human workers and then rest will be leveled by the machine itself only when
the confidence factor is high yes
